body: Is there a speed difference when no code coverage report is generated?

There is no significant difference.
`5.7.9` is taking 1.33 minutes, `5.7.10` is taking 1.29 minutes.

Thank you. It would seem to be related to code coverage.

This [should](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#reporting-issues) have been reported on the [php-code-coverage](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/php-code-coverage) project.
At first I thought that, too. But in both cases phpunit-code-coverage version 4.0.5 was used. So I concluded this is an issue with phpunit.
In that case it probably belongs here.

I cannot reproduce this.

Please provide a **minimal**, **self-contained**, reproducing test case that shows the problem you are reporting.

Without such a minimal, self-contained, reproducing test case I will not be able to investigate this issue.
I just tried version 5.7.9 ... slow aswell. We run tests multiple times per day. First occurance of this was on Feb, 6. Maybe that helps.
What would help would be knowing the last version that is not slow and the first version that is slow.
Well for me the last version which was not slow was `5.7.9` , as shown above. But maybe the perfomance decreased before but not as significantly.

Yes, that is possible. I think we should focus on the difference between 5.7.9 and 5.7.10. Right now I'm testing 5.7.5 with sebastianbergmann/php-code-coverage 4.0.4 which is the last version I have logs from with a short runtime to make sure it is nothing else.

Update: Slow as well o0 ... @mbaeuerle: Are you also using and testing Symfony? Maybe they have changed something.

Another question @mbaeuerle: If you run phpunit 5.7.9 now with PHP 7.1.1, is it still faster?

Good news (at least for phpunit ;) ). This PR from Symfony fixes the issue for us:

https://github.com/symfony/symfony/pull/21556/files

Seems to be unrelated to phpunit.
Is laravel depending on the FramworkBundle of Symfony? If so you could try to limit that to version 3.2.2 as well. Maybe that resolves the issue for you, too.

Laravel is just depending on some packages from symfony and it seems they are already on 3.2.
From composer:
``` json
"symfony/console": "~3.2",
"symfony/debug": "~3.2",
"symfony/finder": "~3.2",
"symfony/http-foundation": "~3.2",
"symfony/http-kernel": "~3.2",
"symfony/process": "~3.2",
"symfony/routing": "~3.2",
"symfony/var-dumper": "~3.2",
```

I just retried the tests, just changing the version of phpUnit, and I still get the same results as before.
3.2 will use the current version which is 3.2.3 and which contains the bug. Can you try and replace ~3.2 with 3.2.2 and run the tests again?
I just tried that, but with no success, still slow with phpUnit 5.7.10 and faster with 5.7.9
Hm, that is weird. Can you upload your composer.lock so I can compare it to ours? Maybe it is some other dependency.

Maybe the slowdown has something to do with changing the coverage strategy? I don't know the details of the fix for issue #2462 (which is the only change from 5.7.9 to 5.7.10) but our code coverage changes between the two versions. 5.7.9: 5.7.10:

The fix for #2462 is comprised of two commits, c9fb2d0b48755613513124516dd21dfae9fd3d08 and 631351297cd5ec850f81aecfc3ac3f3cf7c778c9. As far as I can see, these are the only changes related to code coverage between PHPUnit 5.7.9 and PHPUnit 5.7.10.

The only thing these two commits intended to change was to not fill the whitelist when one is configured but no code coverage report is to be generated, for instance when `--no-coverage` is used.

Looking at your screenshots, @mbaeuerle, the report you get with PHPUnit 5.7.9 looks wrong to me as no details are shown for `StatsController.php`. This would be correct if you have `processUncoveredFilesFromWhitelist="false"` in your `phpunit.xml`. `false` should also be the default value for this configuration option.

The report you get with PHPUnit 5.7.10 looks correct to me as there are details shown for `StatsController.php`. "Correct" assumes, of course, that you have configured `processUncoveredFilesFromWhitelist="true"` in your `phpunit.xml` (and that `StatsController.php` is not covered by any test).

Processing uncovered, whitelisted files to show details for them in the code coverage report is additional work that is otherwise not performed. This additional work could explain the slowdown.

Can you please share your `phpunit.xml` file's `filter/whitelist` section?
